data.title: File Change Detection Should be less sensitive; match to saved file
data.body:
VS Code thinks the file has changed when anything has been typed, regardless of whether the change has been reversed. So it thinks it needs to be saved (and pops up the "Do you want to save changes" message), even if the file is technically the same as the last-saved version. In contrast, the [Atom](https://atom.io/) editor (which I'm trying to migrate to VS Code from) actively diffs file so that no matter what you've typed, if you undo back to the state of the last save, it detects that no material changes were made, and you can just close the file without any further interruption.

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.16.1
- OS Version: OS X El Capitan (10.11.6)

**Steps to Reproduce:**
1. In any file, type a character.
2. Delete the character you just typed, returning the file to its previous state.
3. In the explorer and the file's tab, the changed dot is still present, and trying to close the file gives the "Do you want to save changes" box, even though the file hasn't really changed.

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
**Reproduces without extensions:** Yes

data.title: Telemetry: handle workspaceLoad/workspaceStats properly for multi root
data.body:
Today we log a [`workspaceLoad`](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/electron-browser/shell.ts#L224) and [`workspaceStats`](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/electron-browser/shell.ts#L257) event once on startup of the workbench. When we add support for multi-root workspaces, the logging should be revisited because now the set of folders can change very dynamically also after the workbench was already opened.

I think we should move away from the static logging on startup and adopt the related workspace change events ([`onDidChangeWorkbenchState`](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/platform/workspace/common/workspace.ts#L52), [`onDidChangeWorkspaceFolders`](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/platform/workspace/common/workspace.ts#L62)).

The same is probably true for our workspace stats logging.

/cc @dbaeumer

data.title: Workspaces: add a command to open a folder as workspace in separate window
data.body:
This is for people that suffer from https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/2686 making it a bit easier to open a folder in a separate window.

The command shows up like this:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/900690/31223635-396c3e5e-a9cb-11e7-9ebd-54ff2af3eb31.png)

And it will:
* do nothing in an empty workspace
* in a folder workspace create a new untitled workspace from that folder and open it in a new window. it will also copy any workspace settings over from the folder.
* in a multi folder workspace will ask the user which folder to use

/cc @sandy081 @dbaeumer

data.title: Source Control Providers - Long branch names disappear
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.17.0-insider (81fc22ec957de26d2bf6aada3f16f04e0164741c, 2017-10-03T22:47:28.178Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.7.0
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
EditorConfig|Edi|0.10.1
quokka-vscode|Wal|1.0.68
django-html|bib|1.2.0
vscode-eslint|dba|1.3.2
python|don|0.7.0
gitlens|eam|5.4.1
tslint|eg2|1.0.9
vscode-versionlens|pfl|0.19.1
cucumber|ste|0.9.6

(1 theme extensions excluded)


---

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Add more than one source controlled project to a workspace
2. Switch to `Source Control` view
3. Checkout a branch with a very long name on one of the projects
4. Resize the `Source Control` side panel horizontally

Expected Result:
The long branch name should be trimmed so that it still fits into view.

Actual Result:
The long branch name disappears, not allowing the user to view which branch they are on at a glance, nor to switch quickly between branches.

_Before resize_
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1260402/31216916-7f73513c-a9b5-11e7-840f-55efcee53545.png)
_After resize_
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1260402/31216942-9004832c-a9b5-11e7-9361-040a826ec871.png)


Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: Support for windows magnifier
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version:
- OS Version: Windows 10

I'm a proud user of visual studio and VS code seems very interesting to me. However I'm low vision and because VS code doesn't support windows magnifier, I have a hard time using it. I know this is written using a none platform specific UI system and it might be hard to support windows magnifier but wanted to ask to see if it is possible or not. The issue is that the cursor for writing text is not followed by magnifier since it doesn't report to windows accessibility (UI Automation or MSAA whatever it is) its position.

Thanks for considering it

data.title: Themes: Scoope Settings (Background)
data.body:
Hi there

I'm working on a theme vor Visual Studio Code for our devs.

According to [docs.sublimetext](http://docs.sublimetext.info/en/latest/reference/color_schemes.html#sub-elements-of-settings) it should be possible to define the background Color of "scooped settings"...

Somehow VSC seems to ignore this constantly .
Could it be, VSC isn't allowing background colors for specific code-blocks?

I searched the web for bout 4 hours now and it seems that i can't find any reasons why this should not work at all.

My Code in myTheme.theme.json (made with Yo Code)

```
		{
			"name": "Comments",
			"scope": "comment",
			"settings": {
				"fontStyle": "bold",
				"foreground": "#155230",
				"background" : "#FFFFFF"

			}

```

I'd appreshiate  help or advice on this topic.

Regards
Roman

P.S.: If I should ask this question at another Forum, please let me know.

data.title: Sort recently opened files by recency after I start typing
data.body:
In quick open (`ctrl+p`) the recently opened files are sorted by recency only until I start typing, then scoring is used instead (only when two files get the same score, recency is used again, see https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/20546#issuecomment-334378269).

This is unpleasant on repositories with many files of the same name, for example, we have many READMEs in our monorepo and it's unintuitive why filtering in the recently opened list should change the sort order, or in a bad case, move the item completely out of sight:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/101152/31215164-c3e961b4-a9ae-11e7-9dc5-708e5d4cf0f8.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/101152/31215202-e4c3fe4e-a9ae-11e7-9243-90bd3f2d54fd.png)

I think the natural behavior would be just to sort by recency in this list.

Related issues:

- Unintuitive result scoring with Ctrl-P in recent history #20546
- Recently opened files is just a bucket and not sorted by recency #31591

data.title: Cntrl click on an object reference in a TS file, takes ~17 seconds to open the file
data.body:
- VSCode Version:  1.16.1 64 bit (although this was happening on 32 bit)
- OS Version:

 OS Name:     Windows
 OS Version:  10.0.15063
 OS Platform: Windows

Steps to Reproduce:
1.  When I click on a reference to an object, it takes almost 20 seconds for the file to open up
 For example:  
 I have this contructor:
```
constructor(private seasonsService: SeasonsService) {
  }
```
When I cntl click on SeasonsService, it will take 17 seconds to open up seasons.service.ts file.

This happens on more than one project.    It used to work fine and not sure what would be causing this.

It may be worth noting here that Intelliense in C# stopped working too but TypeScript typed objects still get intellisense.  I logged an issue with the C# extension but that seems much different than the issue I stated here.

data.title: onDidChangeTextEditorViewColumn doesn't fire when an editor is dragged between open columns
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.17.0-insider (f6ef4bef42fa2948426c99fefa340235e67a0c5e, 2017-10-04T17:40:56.306Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.16299
---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Subscribe to the `window.onDidChangeTextEditorViewColumn` event
2. Open a few files with a layout so that you have some tabs in each of 2 columns
3. Drag a tab from one column into the other
4. :bug: Observe that the `window.onDidChangeTextEditorViewColumn` event doesn't fire

It seems that  `window.onDidChangeTextEditorViewColumn` only fires when an editor is the first in a new column or the last in a column.

//cc @jrieken 

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: No

data.title: Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property '1' of null.
data.body:
Hi there, I have no clue what this is about, but it is crashing the app we are developing. It would appear that something (an object I know not what) is null and blowing up the xterm console when I move my mouse in the Chrome browser. - VSCode Version: Code 1.16.1 (27492b6bf3acb0775d82d2f87b25a93490673c6d, 2017-09-14T16:38:23.027Z) - OS Version: Windows_NT x64 6.1.7601 - Extensions: Extension|Author (truncated)|Version ---|---|--- html-snippets|abu|0.1.0 vscode-angular2-files|ale|1.3.10 path-intellisense|chr|1.4.2 jshint|dba|0.10.15 bower|don|0.0.3 githistory|don|0.2.3 vscode-npm-script|eg2|0.2.1 Angular2|joh|2.7.0 csharp|ms-|1.12.1 PowerShell|ms-|1.4.3 debugger-for-chrome|msj|3.3.1 view-in-browser|qin|0.0.5 nativescript|Tel|0.7.2 html-snippets|wge|0.1.5 html-css-class-completion|Zig|1.10.0 --- Steps to Reproduce: 1. Debug the web app in VS Code. 2. Navigate to any view. 3. Move the mouse. The whole app crumbles at: at NgIf.module.exports.NgIf._updateView... I need to use *ngIf for obvious reasons, since this is an angular app. >Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property '1' of null at SelectionModel.areSelectionValuesReversed (C:\Program Files\Microsoft VS Code\resources\app\node_modules\xterm\lib\SelectionModel.js:51) fail: Microsoft.AspNetCore.NodeServices[0] ERROR ReferenceError: document is not defined at createDropCue (C:\Users\dmorri3\Source\repos\revrec.Workbookmanager\rr.webapi\ClientApp\dist\main-server.js:10885:24) at GroupConnectionService.register (C:\Users\dmorri3\Source\repos\revrec.Workbookmanager\rr.webapi\ClientApp\dist\main-server.js:10915:24) at new GroupPanelComponent (C:\Users\dmorri3\Source\repos\revrec.Workbookmanager\rr.webapi\ClientApp\dist\main-server.js:54294:14) at createClass (C:\Users\dmorri3\Source\repos\revrec.Workbookmanager\rr.webapi\ClientApp\dist\vendor.js:21881:26) at createDirectiveInstance (C:\Users\dmorri3\Source\repos\revrec.Workbookmanager\rr.webapi\ClientApp\dist\vendor.js:21699:37) at createViewNodes (C:\Users\dmorri3\Source\repos\revrec.Workbookmanager\rr.webapi\ClientApp\dist\vendor.js:23127:49) at Object.createEmbeddedView (C:\Users\dmorri3\Source\repos\revrec.Workbookmanager\rr.webapi\ClientApp\dist\vendor.js:23010:5) at TemplateRef_.module.exports.TemplateRef_.createEmbeddedView (C:\Users\dmorri3\Source\repos\revrec.Workbookmanager\rr.webapi\ClientApp\dist\vendor.js:21214:38) at ViewContainerRef_.module.exports.ViewContainerRef_.createEmbeddedView (C:\Users\dmorri3\Source\repos\revrec.Workbookmanager\rr.webapi\ClientApp\dist\vendor.js:2099 Honestly, I can't figure out if it is something I am doing wrong. I have not seen this behavior before, and hope never to see it again. Thanks for checking it out. David

Reproduces without extensions: Not sure. When I Control + f5 I get "Configured debug type 'coreclr' is not supported."

data.title: Feature Request: Add API to refresh various debugger panes

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
I'm writing a debug adapter, and there are some events that can happen outside of the normal process that result in vscode not reflecting the correct state.

**Variables**
Sometimes when setting a variable, other variables change in response.  For example, in the image below the HL register is made up of H and L.  Changing HL also changes H & L.  Changing H or L individually also changes HL.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/593662/31198523-84845ec8-a94c-11e7-8e71-e3780e4744e9.png)

**Call Stack**
I've implemented a 'Set Next Statement' via vscode.debug.activeDebugSession.customRequest.  However, there's no way to tell vscode to refresh the call stack to reflect the updated state.

data.title: Editor Automatically Highlights Commented Code With jQuery
data.body:
<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version:  1.16.1 (1.16.1)
- OS Version:  OSX 10.12.6 (16G29)

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Paste this code into an open TypeScript file in the editor. 
2. Move the mouse over any commented code that contains a parenthesis. The entire block will automatically highlight. When additional code is present all code above the comment within the inner block is also highlighted. Moving the mouse off of the comments returns the editor to normal. This happens constantly when using resolved jQuery promises and is very distracting. It appears to have something to do with the presence of the  'fail' block.

```
export function test() {

    $.Deferred().resolve()
        console.log('test')
        // let data: any[] = []
        // _boDetail.forEach(() => {   // <------------- MOUSEOVER HERE
        //     data.push({
        //     })
        // })
        .fail(() => {
        })
}
```

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: Feature Request: Configuration to force documentation popup below current line.
data.body:
Following up from a twitter conversation with @auchenberg yesterday:
https://twitter.com/auchenberg/status/915370598871662592

- VSCode Version: 1.16.1
- OS Version: Mac OSX 10.12.6 (16G29)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. write code (in vim mode if that matters)
2. press `(`.
3. Get popup above current line.
![stylemapping ts template-api 2017-10-04 12-46-08](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1839/31196314-2bf5697c-a902-11e7-964d-51fafb211c3c.png)
4. Be sad that you can't see the code you just typed and now need to use as an argument to the current function call.

I'd like to be able to force this popup to be underneath my current line of code (especially when triggered by typing -- it's not that important when displayed via a mouse interaction).

Other possible config options or solutions might be to have the pop up displayed in a fixed location when triggered by typing (E.g. the upper right corner of the editor window) because sometimes I need to refer to the code below as well :)

Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: Allow for reindenting only selected text
data.body:
Based on feedback from, https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/28658. Particularly https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/28658#issuecomment-314560204

@rebornix This would be very helpful for me and it looks like selection is already supported for `getReindentEditOperations`, it just needed to be wired up.
